sub_title: Digitalization of Agriculture | Data for Agriculture | Climate Change Adaptation
summary:
Didier Muyiramye is an experienced, multi-lingual digital enthusiast researcher with over 8 years’ experience in agribusiness, specializing in digital technologies for agricultural transformation. Throughout his career, he gained a strong capability for providing research and monitoring & evaluation support, with expertise in digital agriculture, climate change adaption strategies, rural development and technology adoption and dissemination. 

He now works for ARABLE, monitoring customer devices' health metrics and helping the customers to solve difficult challenges they face when using Arable tools. Before, he worked for CTA (ACP-EU) and gained strong experiences in research, data capturing, inputting and quality control for M&E systems. He has also worked for PUM Netherlands Senior Experts and AgriProFocus Network, where he developed expertise in farmer profiling, online platform data management and business brokering services. Didier has lived/worked in Rwanda, Sweden and The Netherlands. He has a passion for soccer, long distance running and African anthropology.

profile_positions.description:
. Driving customer retention and expansion and expansion across customer segments
. Developing deep product understanding and using it to help customers solve difficult challenges
. Onboarding new customers on how to effectively install and deploy Arable's devices, and how to access and interpret data on Arable's Web and Mobile apps
. Monitoring, responding to, and resolving inbound customer inquiries to ensure customers are having a strong experience and are generating value with Arable tools
. Monitoring customer health metrics and intervening as early as possible when risks and problems arise
. Developing strong relationships with customers and turning them into Arable champions
. Understanding customers' business challenges and industry trends and consult on how Arable can help them achieve their objectives
. Raising critical customer concerns internally and mobilize resources to resolve issues
. Adding new projects from customers' feedback and requests on product improvement (new features on Mobile app and Web app)
.Advocating for the needs of customers to team members in different departments
. Preparing content that educates users on how to fully utilize Arable's tools 
. Owning end-to-end problem solving efforts from discovery & exploration through resolution and implementation (both for customer and internal operations projects)
. Developing cross-functional initiatives that improve the overall customer experience and lead to greater satisfaction and loyalty among our customers
. Utilizing quantitative and qualitative analysis to transform complex datasets into actionable insights
profile_positions.title: Customer Success

profile_positions.location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
profile_positions.description: Freelance research and M&E consultant (with expertise in ICT4Ag, Climate Change Adaptation strategies, Rural Development, Technology adoption and dissemination) providing consulting services in Proposal Writing, and projects' Monitoring and Evaluation
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Facilitating the training and field activity on Digital agricultural Extension content production to capacitate youth in production and use of digital extension content and tools. The specific tasks include:
1. Offline facilitation of the training of youth on extension video production
2. Coordinating the video production process
3. Quality assurance, Monitoring and Reporting of the video production activities.
profile_positions.title: Project Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Conducting research on “COVID-19 and Agriculture in Africa: implications for Digitalisation” (by Didier Muyiramye and Benjamin Kwasi Addom, PhD - August 2020)
• Assist with data capturing, inputting, and quality control within the Centres’ Monitoring & Evaluation systems.
• Liaise between the Learning, Monitoring & Evaluation unit of CTA and the
programme units for data validation.
profile_positions.title: Research, Monitoring and Evaluation Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the ICT4Ag team at CTA. I assisted in the reporting and Monitoring & Evaluation of the ICTs for Agriculture projects' activities. The specific tasks included:

- Documenting the impacts of Data4Ag program achievements through writing of blog articles, working paper, impact reports, and project completion reports, and co-publishing them together with the Program Coordinator and partners.
- Support in the formulation and review of project-level logical frameworks, theories of change, indicators, etc.
- Liaising with program beneficiaries in tracking and updating the projects’ logical frameworks within the M&E software (DELTA and PowerBi).
- Reviewing and summarizing project study reports (baseline, mid-term review and end-of projects’ reports) as compiled by hired consultants.
- In collaboration with the program coordinator, organise and facilitate both physical and online program meetings, webinars and events on the status of projects’ implementation.
- Provide administrative support as well as managing the repository system containing the ICTs for agriculture (ICT4Ag) projects’ files.
- Collaborating with the Project Assistant in drafting procurement contracts and monitoring their implementation.
- Undertaking other tasks relevant to the efficient running of the Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning, as assigned by the Program coordinator and/or MEL specialist.
profile_positions.title: ICT4Ag Monitoring and Reporting Officer

profile_positions.description:
1.	Scouting potential customer: 
- Identifying and approaching potential customers that meet PUM’s application criteria as well as the targets drawn up in the yearly country plan.

2.	Carrying out promotion. 
- Organise promotional activities or press moments
- Talk about PUM during network meetings 
- Organise free publicity.

3.	Assistance during application
- Support a prospective customer with filling out the application form according to the PUM procedure.
- Verify the data filled out by the customer
- Give an assessment of the customer to PUM.

4.	Assistance during the mission 
-  Work as the contact person for the customer and expert during the mission. Ensure it all goes smoothly
. Assist to resolve problems that might occur.

5.	After care
- Make sure an expert’s mission actually ‘delivers’ in terms of positive, concrete results:
o	Submits a debriefing form.
o	Make an effort to have the customer fill out the debriefing form. 
o	Actively be involved with the customer to execute the project plan
profile_positions.title: Local Representative
Country Network Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: I am part of the IBISA Watchers team that carries out a collaborative assessment on the status of smallholder farmers' vegetation around the world, evaluating the damages that result from changes in weather and climate events. The assessment is done using Earth Observation satellite data.

I am part of 'Mentoring Generation Africa' - a gender-based mentoring program established for African men to mentor the next generation of male leaders in Africa.  'Mentoring Generation Africa' is managed by the same team managing 'Global Give Back Circle' - a gender-based mentoring program for women.  We are applying the same mentoring program structures and methodologies that have worked successfully for Global Give Back Circle for the past 15 years.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer for the 2018 World Water Week
volunteer_experiences.description:
On a voluntary basis, I have been involved as a conference assistant in the 2018 World Water Week in Stockholm, The conference took place 26-31 August 2018 under the theme ''Water, Ecosystems and Human Development''. The World Water Week is organised by the Stockholm International Water Institute (SIWI).

My main tasks were to assist in all different World Water Week sessions, support the SIWI secretariat work and assist conference participants,
